DataElement.preferredName: Demographics  Patient Place of Death Address Country Three Character Code
DataElement.preferredDefinition: Code for the country in which the patient died and where certificate of death is filed.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Demographics Patient Location of Death Address Country
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: The statistical characterization of human populations or segments of human populations (e.g., characterization by age, sex, race, or income)._A person who receives medical attention, care, or treatment, or who is registered with medical professional or institution with the purpose to receive medical care when necessary._The physical place at which the subject ceased to live._A standardized representation of the location of a person, business, building, or organization._A collective generic term that refers here to a wide variety of dependencies, areas of special sovereignty, uninhabited islands, and other entities in addition to the traditional countries or independent states.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: statistical characterization of human populations (or segments of human populations broken down by age or sex or income etc.).

Concepts.definition: The statistical characterization of human populations or segments of human populations (e.g., characterization by age, sex, race, or income).

Property.preferredName: Patient Location of Death Address Country
Property.preferredDefinition: A person who receives medical attention, care, or treatment, or who is registered with medical professional or institution with the purpose to receive medical care when necessary.:The physical place at which the subject ceased to live.:A standardized representation of the location of a person, business, building, or organization.:A collective generic term that refers here to a wide variety of dependencies, areas of special sovereignty, uninhabited islands, and other entities in addition to the traditional countries or independent states.

Concepts.definition: A person who receives medical attention, care, or treatment, or who is registered with medical professional or institution with the purpose to receive medical care when necessary.
The physical place at which the subject ceased to live.
A standardized representation of the location of a person, business, building, or organization.

A collective generic term that refers here to a wide variety of dependencies, areas of special sovereignty, uninhabited islands, and other entities in addition to the traditional countries or independent states.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: all components of an address, including building number, street name and type, city, state, postal code, and country.

DataElementConcept.origin: NAACCR:North American Association of Central Cancer Registries

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: A collective generic term that refers here to a wide variety of dependencies, areas of special sovereignty, uninhabited islands, and other entities in addition to the traditional countries or independent states._A natural number greater than 2 and less than 4 and the quantity that it denotes: the sum of two and one._Any single letter, number, or symbol._A symbol or combination of symbols which is assigned to the members of a collection.

A natural number greater than 2 and less than 4 and the quantity that it denotes: the sum of two and one.
